oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Sergt. York to Preach Sunday," newspaper article

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Preaching; Clippings (Books, newspapers, etc.); Scrapbooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Newspaper clipping featuring a headline stating Sergeant York would be preaching Sunday at the Belmont Methodist Church in the morning and the Pentecostal Church in the evening. The article states that large crowds are expected and a major celebration is planned.

Alvin York was one of the most decorated American soldiers in World War I. He was awarded a Medal of Honor and a French Croix de Guerre for capturing a German machine gun nest and assisting in the capture of 132 German soldiers.
